understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method called journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if the _journalSerializer variable is not null and returns it, otherwise it creates a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration of the Prevayler system. It is responsible for providing a Serializer object for journaling purposes. The configuration allows for the customization of the Serializer used for journaling, with a default fallback to JavaSerializer if no custom Serializer is provided.

understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if a _journalSerializer object is not null, then returns it, otherwise it returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining which Serializer object to use. It checks if a custom Serializer object (_journalSerializer) is provided, and if not, it falls back to using a default JavaSerializer object. This method is crucial for configuring the serialization behavior in the system.

developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is used in the create() method to initialize a Prevayler instance. It is passed as a parameter to the PrevaylerImpl constructor along with other necessary parameters.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is triggered whenever a new Prevayler instance is created using the create() method. The frequency of triggering depends on how often new Prevayler instances are needed in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how it affects the behavior of the Prevayler instance. Depending on the value set for _transactionDeepCopyMode, it can impact the memory usage and performance of the system.
